quizzes.title: History Quiz: Ernest Hemingway and Mariel Hemingway
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, richardson, soul. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Mariel Hemingway is Margaux Hemingways mother.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: For which book did Ernest Hemingway win a Pulitzer Prize in 1953?

options.text: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.question: Ernest Hemingways mother dressed him in girls clothing when he was little.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the book Wizard and Glass, the gunslingers and Oy disembark from the monorail train at which station?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Topeka

questions.question: In what year did Ernest Hemingway die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1961

questions.question: Margaux Hemingway was Ernest Hemingways daughter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In Don DeLillos novel, White Noise, professor Jack Gladney finds out that his wife participates in an experimental study of a new psychoactive drug, called Dylar. Which of the following does this medication treat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the fear of death

questions.question: Mariel Hemingway is famous for playing the role of Tracy in what 1979 Woody Allen film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manhattan

questions.question: Elizabeth Hadley Richardson married Ernest Hemingway in 1935.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The novel Wizard and Glass picks up where Dark Tower III: The Waste Lands left off.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Mariel Hemingway never starred in a Superman movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Hemingways have a history of suicides.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Ernest Hemingway served in the army.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who does Dr. Faustus summon, after he sells his soul to the devil for power and knowledge, in the play The Tragical History of Doctor Faustus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen of Troy

questions.question: Margaux Hemingway never appeared in a movie with her sister.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Glass
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, fiction, gilead. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: During the battle in the book Wizard and Glass, Roland captures the Wizards Glass, a malevolent crystal ball that shows him visions of his future. What colour is the Wizards Glass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pink

questions.question: Stephen King wrote about half of this novel in room 217 of the Stanely Hotel in Colorado.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Shining

questions.question: The author of the best-selling novel, The Call of the Wild, was a war reporter, covering the Russo-Japanese War. Can you guess his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack London

questions.question: When Roland first left Gilead in the novel Wizard and Glass, he was accompanied by two of his close friends. What were their names?

options.text: Cuthbert Allgood and Jamie De Curry
Jamie De Curry and Sheemie Ruiz

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuthbert Allgood and Alain Johns

questions.question: Famous fiction characters Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn were from the small town of St. Petersburg, which was modeled by Mark Twain after his home town. Where was St. Petersburg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal, Missouri

questions.question: What is Romeos last name in Shakespeares play Romeo and Juliet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montague

questions.question: Robert Southey, one of the English Lake Poets, became known for what fairy tale?

options.text: Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goldilocks and the Three Bears

questions.question: The novel entitled Cosette ou le Temps des Illusions (Cosette or the Time of Illusions), written by Francois Ceresa, is sequel to what Victor Hugo novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Les Miserables

questions.question: On Friday 13th in 2006, American author Lemony Snicket released his last book of A Series of Unfortunate Events, featuring the Baudelaire children. How many books does the series contain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13

questions.question: In the book Wizard and Glass, Roland and his original ka-tet travel to the Barony of Mejis on order of Rolands father. What task had they been instructed to carry out?

options.text: Count how many horses were held within the Barony
Gather information about agents of John Farson and their activities

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gather information about agents of John Farson and their activities

questions.question: In Wizard and Glass, one night, Roland begins to tell the rest of the ka-tet the story of his earlier life. At what age did he earn his guns to become the youngest ever gunslinger?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14

questions.question: Why is Joseph K. arrested in Franz Kafkas popular novel, The Trial?

options.text: He was accused of robbing a bank

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The reason is never explained.

questions.question: Who did Ralph Nader criticize in his book Unsafe at Any Speed, published in 1965?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Auto Industry

questions.question: What is the name of the Kansas City baseball team whose stadium the ka-tet pass on their journey in the novel Wizard and Glass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monarchs

questions.question: In the book Wizard and Glass, Roland and his young friends defeat a troop of Farsons men by making them ride into a canyon which houses a thinny - an eerie dimensional hole through which people can travel across dimensions.  What is the name of the canyon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eyebolt

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Dorothy Parker and Eragon
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, fiction, recluse. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these words/phrases of the ancient language, featured in the books Eragon and Eldest, is not paired with its correct meaning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: adurna - the morning star

questions.question: Dorothy Parker wrote movie reviews for which magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanity Fair

questions.question: Which of these cities, described by fantasy fiction writer Christopher Paolini, is not located in Du Weldenvarden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buragh

questions.question: Dorothy Parker worked for 4 magazines. Which list shows the correct order in which she worked for them?

options.text: Vogue, Vanity Fair, The New Yorker, Esquire
Vanity Fair, Esquire, Vogue, The New Yorker
Esquire, Vanity Fair, The New Yorker, Vogue
The New Yorker, Vogue, Vanity Fair, Esquire

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vogue, Vanity Fair, The New Yorker, Esquire

questions.question: Dorothy Parker grew up in an extremely close family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Dorothy Parker was a recluse all her life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Dorothy Parker never married.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Martin Rothschild was Dorothy Parkers uncle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was Dorthy Parkers last film project?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fan - 1949

questions.question: What novel by Jane Austen was originally titled Elinor and Marianne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sense and Sensibility

questions.question: What is the name of the town, where Eragon from the self-titled book lives, until he becomes a dragon rider and makes his journey to the Varden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carvahall

questions.question: Dorothy Parker had an affair with F. Scott Fitzgerald.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the title of Dorothy Parkers first poetry collection?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Enough Rope

questions.question: Dorothy Parker wrote the script for what famous 1937 movie starring Janet Gaynor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Star Is Born

questions.question: When was Dorothy Parker born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: August 1893

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and Eragon
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, fiction, affair. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The books Eragon and Eldest are from which book series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inheritance Trilogy

questions.question: Did Rayford Steele ever have an affair with senior flight attendant Hattie Durham in the novel Left Behind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: In the Christian-themed novel Left Behind, charter pilot Ken Ritz had his own theory on the vanishings. He thought they were caused by aliens abducting the millions of missing people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the books Eragon and Eldest, wierda is the ancient language word meaning fate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the book Left Behind, Chaim Rozenzweig was a botanist who developed The Eden Formula, that caused the deserts of Israel to bloom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the novel Left Behind, character Rayford Steele is a pilot for Pan-American Airways.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the Christian-themed novel Left Behind, Cameron Buck Williams is senior writer for which news magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Global Weekly

questions.question: According to Pastor Bruce Barnes from the novel Left Behind, the Tribulation will begin when the Anti-Christ makes a peace treaty between which countries?

options.text: The United States and the West European countries
Israel and all of its enemies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Israel and all of its enemies

questions.question: What is the name given to the mysterious disappearance of millions of people worldwide by Nicolae Carpathia in the Christian fiction book Left Behind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Vanishings

questions.question: In the Christian fiction book Left Behind, Rayford and eventually Buck believe Nicolae Carpathia is the Antichrist described in several books of the New Testament.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The first word in the novel Eragon is a proper noun (excluding the prologue).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Joshua Todd-Cothran is the head of what financial institution from the novel Left Behind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The London Stock Exchange

questions.question: In the novels Eragon and Eldest, zarroc is the ancient language word translated as misery. What else does the word refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a sword

questions.question: Left Behind character Bruce Barnes believes The Tribulation would last how many years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: Left Behind character Buck Williams is drawn into a murder mystery when an old friend of his is mysteriously killed by a sniper.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Poet and Poem
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, title, adonais—he. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: I weep for Adonais—he is dead!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Percy Bysshe Shelly

questions.question: Who wrote the book Running with Scissors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Augusten Burroughs

questions.question: Coleridge, Southey, and Wordsworth all resided in the Lake Country of England near Grasmere.  What were these three referred to as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lake Poets

questions.question: He was a close friend of Byron and an incredibly popular singer, songwriter.  Which Irish entertainer and poet, who wrote the lyrics to “The Minstrel Boy,” wrote these lines as well?

options.text: d hearts that once beat high for praise now feel that pulse no more.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Moore

questions.question: What is the title of William S. Burroughs semi-autobiographical novel depicting the lifestyle of heroin addicts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Junky

questions.question: What was Lord Byron’s original name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Gordon

questions.question: Who wrote these famous lines and in what poem can they be found?

options.text: d all ye need to know.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keats—Ode on a Grecian Urn

questions.question: This actress, who won an Oscar at the age of 10, wrote a scathing memoir titled A Paper Life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tatum ONeal

questions.question: He was a close friend of Wordsworth. He wrote “Kubla Khan” and the following lines from his most popular poem:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coleridge

questions.question: This nature lover felt that poetry should reflect the simple tongue of the common man and that poetry is basically “emotion recollected in tranquility.” Which renowned poet penned “Tintern Abbey” and “I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Wordsworth

questions.question: Barack Obamas first memoir is entitled Dreams from My Father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Queer was a memoir penned by Allen Ginsberg.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This conservative, aristocratic poet and novelist was the pride of both Scotland and England. His martial poetry was an inspiration during war. What author of “Waverly” penned the following poem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Walter Scott

questions.question: David Sedaris wrote the book Dry which details his life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Lord Byron was the lusty, adventurous poet of revolt. He wrote once, “I awoke one morning and found myself famous.” What widely popular travel poem did this bohemian baron write which garnered the fame to which he referred?

options.text: So We’ll Go No More A Roving

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Childe Harold’s Pilgrimage

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and Character
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, books, bloor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the first novel of a popular series which has a main character named Twig.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beyond the Deep Woods

questions.question: Which novel features the fictional Herdman family?

options.text: The Imp That Ate My Homework

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Best Halloween Ever

questions.question: Shona Silkfin becomes friends with the title character of which novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tail of Emily Windsnap

questions.question: In which popular hockey novel does the character Nish appear?

options.text: The Night They Stole the Stanley Cup

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Night They Stole the Stanley Cup

questions.question: Rocky is the best friend of the protagonist in which novel?

options.text: Molly Moons Incredible Book of Hypnotism

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Molly Moons Incredible Book of Hypnotism

questions.question: Soren is a fictional character depicted in which book??
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Capture

questions.question: Eli Weisels book Night is about the Holocaust.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In which novel does the character Dustfinger appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inkheart

questions.question: Mrs. Granger is a popular teacher who appears in this novel.

options.text: My Life as a Fifth-Grade Comedian

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frindle

questions.question: Which Hollywood legends daughter penned the memoir Mommy Dearest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joan Crawford

questions.question: Luke is the main character in which of the following books?

questions.question: Parvana is the protagonist of this Canadian novel.
